metadata.description: The location to use for the deployment. defaults to Resource Groups location.
Used to name all resources
Are you providing your own vNet CIDR blocks
Full resource id path of an existing subnet to use for AKS
Full resource id path of an existing pod subnet to use for AKS
Full resource id path of an existing subnet to use for Application Gateway
The name of an existing User Assigned Identity to use for the AKS Control Plane (in the same resouce group), requires rbac assignments to be done outside of this template
The address range for the custom vnet
The address range for AKS in your custom vnet
The address range for the App Gateway in your custom vnet
The address range for the ACR in your custom vnet
The address range for Azure Bastion in your custom vnet
The address range for private link in your custom vnet
The address range for Azure Firewall in your custom vnet
The address range for Azure Firewall Management in your custom vnet
Enable support for private links (required custom_vnet)
Enable support for ACR private pool
Deploy Azure Bastion to your vnet. (works with Custom Networking only, not BYO)
Deploy NSGs to your vnet subnets. (works with Custom Networking only, not BYO)
Configure Flow Logs for Network Security Groups in the NetworkWatcherRG resource group. Requires Contributor RBAC on NetworkWatcherRG and Reader on Subscription.
The full Azure resource ID of the DNS zone to use for the AKS cluster
Creates a KeyVault
If soft delete protection is enabled
If purge protection is enabled
Add IP to KV firewall allow-list
Installs the AKS KV CSI provider
Rotation poll interval for the AKS KV CSI provider
The principal ID of the user or service principal that requires access to the Key Vault. Set automatedDeployment to toggle between user and service prinicpal
Enable encryption at rest for Kubernetes etcd data
Bring an existing Key from an existing Key Vault
The resource group for the existing KMS Key Vault
The PrincipalId of the deploying user, which is necessary when creating a Kms Key
The SKU to use for the Container Registry
Enable the ACR Content Trust Policy, SKU must be set to Premium
Enable removing of untagged manifests from ACR
The number of days to retain untagged manifests for
The principal ID of the service principal to assign the push role to the ACR
Create an Azure Firewall, requires custom_vnet
Add application rules to the firewall for certificate management.
Create an Application Gateway
The number of applciation gateway instances
The maximum number of application gateway instances
A known private ip in the Application Gateway subnet range to be allocated for internal traffic
Enable key vault integration for application gateway
The SKU for AppGw
Enable the WAF Firewall, valid for WAF_v2 SKUs
DNS prefix. Defaults to {resourceName}-dns
Kubernetes Version
Enable Azure AD integration on AKS
The ID of the Azure AD tenant
Create, and use a new Log Analytics workspace for AKS logs
Enables the ContainerLogsV2 table to be of type Basic
Enable RBAC using AAD
Enables Kubernetes Event-driven Autoscaling (KEDA)
Enables Open Service Mesh
Enables SGX Confidential Compute plugin
Enables the Blob CSI driver
Enables the File CSI driver
Enables the Disk CSI driver
AKS upgrade channel
OS disk type
VM SKU
Disk size in GB
The number of agents for the user node pool
The maximum number of nodes for the user node pool
Name for user node pool
Allocate pod ips dynamically
The maximum number of pods per node.
The network plugin type
The network plugin type
Use Cilium dataplane (requires azure networkPlugin)
The network policy to use.
Enable the Azure Policy addon
The IP addresses that are allowed to access the API server
Enable private cluster
Private cluster dns advertisment method, leverages the dnsApiPrivateZoneId parameter
The full Azure resource ID of the privatelink DNS zone to use for the AKS cluster API Server
The zones to use for a node pool
Disable local K8S accounts for AAD enabled clusters
Use the paid sku for SLA rather than SLO
The address range to use for pods
The address range to use for services
The IP address to reserve for DNS
The address range to use for the docker bridge
Enable Microsoft Defender for Containers (preview)
Only use the system node pool
The System Pool Preset sizing
A custom system pool spec
Outbound traffic type for the egress traffic of your cluster
Create a new Nat Gateway, applies to custom networking only
The effective outbound IP resources of the cluster NAT gateway
Outbound flow idle timeout in minutes for NatGw
Configures the cluster as an OIDC issuer for use with Workload Identity
Installs Azure Workload Identity into the cluster
Assign a public IP per node for user node pools
The name of the NEW resource group to create the AKS cluster managed resources in
The restriction level applied to the cluster node resource group
The User Node pool OS
The User Node pool OS SKU
If automated deployment, for the 3 automated user assignments, set Principal Type on each to "ServicePrincipal" rarter than "User"
The principal ID to assign the AKS admin role.
Add the Dapr extension
Enable high availability (HA) mode for the Dapr control plane
Diagnostic categories to log
Enable SysLogs and send to log analytics
Enable Metric Alerts
Which Metric polling frequency model to use
The Log Analytics retention period
The Log Analytics daily data cap (GB) (0=no limit)
Create an Event Grid System Topic for AKS events
Enable usage and telemetry feedback to Microsoft.

When the script resource is cleaned up

properties.scriptContent:
#!/bin/bash
      set -e

      echo "Waiting on RBAC replication ($initialDelay)"
      sleep $initialDelay
      
      #Retry loop to catch errors (usually RBAC delays, but 'Error copying blobs' is also not unheard of)
      retryLoopCount=0
      until [ $retryLoopCount -ge $retryMax ]
      do
        echo "Importing Image: $imageName into ACR: $acrName"
        az acr import -n $acrName --source $imageName --force \
          && break

        sleep $retrySleep
        retryLoopCount=$((retryLoopCount+1))
      done

metadata.description: An array of the imported images

parameters.fwManagementSubnetId: [if(and(and(parameters('azureFirewalls'), parameters('custom_vnet')), equals(parameters('azureFirewallSku'), 'Basic')), createObject('value', reference(resourceId('Microsoft.Resources/deployments', take(format('{0}-network', deployment().name), 64)), '2022-09-01').outputs.fwMgmtSubnetId.value), createObject('value', ''))]

ruleCollections.name: CoreAksNetEgress
ruleCollections.rules: [concat(createArray(createObject('name', 'ControlPlaneTCP', 'ruleType', 'NetworkRule', 'ipProtocols', createArray('TCP'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')), 'destinationAddresses', createArray(format('AzureCloud.{0}', parameters('location'))), 'destinationPorts', createArray('9000', '22')), createObject('name', 'ControlPlaneUDP', 'ruleType', 'NetworkRule', 'ipProtocols', createArray('UDP'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')), 'destinationAddresses', createArray(format('AzureCloud.{0}', parameters('location'))), 'destinationPorts', createArray('1194')), createObject('name', 'AzureMonitorForContainers', 'ruleType', 'NetworkRule', 'ipProtocols', createArray('TCP'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')), 'destinationAddresses', createArray('AzureMonitor'), 'destinationPorts', createArray('443'))), if(parameters('acrPrivatePool'), createArray(createObject('name', 'acr-agentpool', 'ruleType', 'NetworkRule', 'ipProtocols', createArray('TCP'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('acrAgentPoolSubnetAddressPrefix')), 'destinationAddresses', createArray('AzureKeyVault', 'Storage', 'EventHub', 'AzureActiveDirectory', 'AzureMonitor'), 'destinationPorts', createArray('443'))), createArray()))]

ruleCollections.name: CoreAksHttpEgress
ruleCollections.rules: [concat(createArray(createObject('name', 'aks', 'ruleType', 'ApplicationRule', 'protocols', createArray(createObject('port', 443, 'protocolType', 'Https'), createObject('port', 80, 'protocolType', 'Http')), 'targetFqdns', createArray(), 'fqdnTags', createArray('AzureKubernetesService'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')))), if(parameters('certManagerFW'), createArray(createObject('name', 'certman-quay', 'ruleType', 'ApplicationRule', 'protocols', createArray(createObject('port', 443, 'protocolType', 'Https'), createObject('port', 80, 'protocolType', 'Http')), 'targetFqdns', createArray('quay.io', '*.quay.io'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix'))), createObject('name', 'certman-letsencrypt', 'ruleType', 'ApplicationRule', 'protocols', createArray(createObject('port', 443, 'protocolType', 'Https'), createObject('port', 80, 'protocolType', 'Http')), 'targetFqdns', createArray('letsencrypt.org', '*.letsencrypt.org'), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')))), createArray()), if(and(parameters('certManagerFW'), not(empty(parameters('appDnsZoneName')))), createArray(createObject('name', 'certman-appDnsZoneName', 'ruleType', 'ApplicationRule', 'protocols', createArray(createObject('port', 443, 'protocolType', 'Https'), createObject('port', 80, 'protocolType', 'Http')), 'targetFqdns', createArray(parameters('appDnsZoneName'), format('*.{0}', parameters('appDnsZoneName'))), 'sourceAddresses', createArray(parameters('vnetAksSubnetAddressPrefix')))), createArray()))]
